Package jMidiSequencerBeta.model

Interface CompositionBuilder<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the constructed composition
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JMidiComposition.Builder
    public interface CompositionBuilder<T>
    A builder of compositions. Since we do not know in advance what the name of the main type is for a model, we parameterize this builder interface by an unknown type.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      CompositionBuilder<T> addNote​(int start, int end, int instrument, int pitch, int volume)
      Adds a new note to the piece.
      CompositionBuilder<T> addRepeat​(Repeat repeat)
      Adds repeats to the piece.
      T build()
      Constructs an actual composition, given the notes that have been added.
      CompositionBuilder<T> setTempo​(int tempo)
      Sets the tempo of the piece.

    • Method Detail

      • build

        T build()
        Constructs an actual composition, given the notes that have been added.
        Returns:
        The new composition.

      • setTempo

        CompositionBuilder<T> setTempo​(int tempo)
        Sets the tempo of the piece.
        Parameters:
        tempo - The speed, in microseconds per beat.
        Returns:
        This builder.

      • addRepeat

        CompositionBuilder<T> addRepeat​(Repeat repeat)
        Adds repeats to the piece.
        Parameters:
        repeat - , the Repeat object.

      • addNote

        CompositionBuilder<T> addNote​(int start,
                              int end,
                              int instrument,
                              int pitch,
                              int volume)
        Adds a new note to the piece.
        Parameters:
        start - The start time of the note, in beats.
        end - The end time of the note, in beats.
        instrument - The instrument number (to be interpreted by MIDI).
        pitch - The pitch (in the range [0, 127], where 60 represents C4, the middle-C on a piano).
        volume - The volume (in the range [0, 127]).
